Dispute_Type: Refugee protection claim based on fear of persecution due to corruption allegations
Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant took reasonable steps to seek state protection in Mexico
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant filed complaints in Mexico but relocated without waiting for responses; threats and corruption allegations documented
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate inability or unwillingness to avail themselves of state protection
Legal_Rule: Claimant must show they are unable or unwilling to access state protection due to risk; presumption of state protection applies unless rebutted
Procedural_Issue: Tribunal failed to adequately analyze availability of state protection
Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution in Mexico due to corruption accusations
Outcome_on_Merits: Not determined – case remitted for re-determination
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Tribunal's analysis was inadequate, leading to procedural unfairness
Key_Evidence_Considered: Threats faced by applicant, complaints filed with Mexican authorities, lack of response awaited
Applicant_Challenge: State protection not reasonably available due to corruption and personal risk
Evidence_Type: Narrative testimony, documentation of complaints, context country evidence
Remedy_Requested: Recognition as a protected person under IRPA
Outcome: Application allowed in part; judicial review granted
Remedy_Sought: Quashing of tribunal decision and remittal for re-hearing
Legal_Provision: Section of IRPA relating to Convention refugee definition
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections on refugee protection and eligibility
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Alleged persecution due to corruption accusations in Mexico
Outcome_of_Review: In favor of applicant – decision set aside
Governing_Rule: Presumption of state protection unless rebutted by credible evidence
